page.title: 08Folk Festival in Wimborne
page.content: The fourth Wimborne Folk Festival took place from 7th to 9th June, l985. There was a procession through the town with twenty four different groups of performers including many local morrismen. The morrismen danced in the Square and around the Cornmarket. The ladies wore patchwork clothes in red and white and the men had red trousers and white shirts. They had bells around their wrists and ankles which made a nice jingle as they danced and they used sticks in their dance. Men were playing drums, trumpets, violins and an accordian. Some groups came from as far as Somerset, Lancashire and Kent. There were song sessions, a street market and ceilidhs taking place all over the town and various activities were held at the Allendale Centre. The event was sponsored by Two Counties Radio.
